abstract: New York Giants wide receiver Victor Cruz, recovering from knee surgery and strained calf muscle, practices with team for first time in over month; hopes to play in upcoming game against Buffalo Bills.
lead_paragraph: Cruz, a wide receiver, ran about 20 pass routes without discomfort in either his surgically rebuilt right knee or his strained left calf muscle. “Everything feels good; everything is starting to click,” he said.

headline.main: Giants’ Victor Cruz Returns to Practice
headline.print_headline: Giants’ Cruz Runs Pass Drills and Says He Expects to Play

snippet: Cruz, a wide receiver, ran about 20 pass routes without discomfort in either his surgically rebuilt right knee or his strained left calf muscle. “Everything feels good; everything is starting to click,” he said.
